no.uib.triogen.io.genotypes.bgen.reader

Class BgenVariantData

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.uib.triogen.io.genotypes.bgen.reader.BgenVariantData

  • public class BgenVariantData
extends Object
    Genotypes provider based on a bgen file.
    Author:
    Marc Vaudel

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(String sampleId)
      Returns a boolean indicating whether genotyping information is available for the given sample.
      double getAlleleFrequency(int testedAlleleIndex)
      Returns the estimate of the frequency of the given allele.
      double[] getHaplotypes(String childId, String motherId, String fatherId, int testedAlleleIndex)
      Returns the haplotypes in an array: {motherNonTransmitted, motherTransmitted, fatherTransmitted, fatherNonTransmitted}.Null if the child or both parents are missing.If a parent is missing, haplotypes are distributed according to the maf.
      int getnChildrenGenotyped()
      Returns the number of genotyped children.
      int[] getOrderedAlleles()
      Returns the indexes of the alleles ordered by decreasing frequency.
      int getPloidy(String sampleId)
      Returns the ploidy for the given sample.
      double getProbability(String sampleId, int z, int alleleIndex)
      Returns the probability for the given allele in the given contig and sample.
      double getSummedProbability(String sampleId, int alleleIndex)
      Returns the sum of probabilities for the given allele and sample over all contigs.
      double getSummedProbability(String sampleId, int alleleIndex, int ploidy)
      Returns the sum of probabilities for the given allele and sample over all contigs.
      VariantInformation getVariantInformation()
      Returns information on the variant.
      boolean isSwappedChildrenAlleles()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the given allele should be swapped in children.
      void parse(ChildToParentMap childToParentMap)
      Parses the variant data.
      void swapChildrenAlleles()
      Indicate that children alleles should be swapped.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BgenVariantData

        public BgenVariantData(String[] sampleIds,
                       VariantInformation variantInformation,
                       ByteBuffer dataBlockContent,
                       int blockLength,
                       int compressionType,
                       HashMap<Integer,char[]> inheritanceMap,
                       int defaultMotherPloidy,
                       int defaultFatherPloidy)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        sampleIds - The sample ids of the bgen file.
        variantInformation - Information on the variant.
        dataBlockContent - The content of the data block.
        blockLength - The total block length.
        compressionType - The type of compression used.
        inheritanceMap - The allele inheritance map to use.
        defaultMotherPloidy - The default ploidy for mothers.
        defaultFatherPloidy - The default ploidy for fathers.

      • getHaplotypes

        public double[] getHaplotypes(String childId,
                              String motherId,
                              String fatherId,
                              int testedAlleleIndex)
        Returns the haplotypes in an array: {motherNonTransmitted, motherTransmitted, fatherTransmitted, fatherNonTransmitted}.Null if the child or both parents are missing.If a parent is missing, haplotypes are distributed according to the maf.
        Parameters:
        childId - The child id.
        motherId - The mother id.
        fatherId - The father id.
        testedAlleleIndex - The index of the allele tested in the variant information.
        Returns:
        The haplotypes in an array.
